Package sdds.lab2.task2

Class Account

java.lang.Object
sdds.lab2.task2.Account
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Account extends Object implements Serializable
Account class holds data, that is stored inside the master data file for each account. It defines 2 constructors and getter setter methods for all the attributes in this class.
Since:
08/02/2022
Version:
1.0
Author:
Soham Thaker
See Also:
  • TransactionRecord
  • Serializable
  • Serialized Form

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private long
    accountNumber
    A unique account number that is being retrieved from the master data file and then stored into this attribute.
    private double
    balance
    Balance of the account holder that is a running total of transactions and payments made by the account holder at the end of each billing cycle.
    private String
    name
    Holds the name of the account holder.

    A custom constructor that initializes an instance of Account and its data members to the values that are passed in as arguments to this constructor.

  • Constructor Details

    • Account

      public Account(long accountNumber, String name, double balance)
      A custom constructor that initializes an instance of Account and its data members to the values that are passed in as arguments to this constructor.
      Parameters:
      accountNumber - unique account number of the user.
      name - name of the user.
      balance - balance of the user.

    • Account

      public Account()
      A default constructor that initializes an empty instance of Account by calling the three argument constructor. In other terms it initializes that current object's attributes to its default value.

  • Method Details

    • getAccountNumber

      public long getAccountNumber()
      A public getter method that returns the accountNumber attribute stored within current object when called.
      Returns:
      accountNumber attribute of the current object.

    • setAccountNumber

      public void setAccountNumber(long accountNumber)
      A public setter method that sets the accountNumber attribute stored within current object when called.
      Parameters:
      accountNumber - a long number that is passed to this function when called so that current instance's accountNumber attribute can be set to the value of argument.

    • getBalance

      public double getBalance()
      A public getter method that returns the balance attribute stored within current object when called.
      Returns:
      balance attribute of the current object.

    • setBalance

      public void setBalance(double balance)
      A public setter method that sets the balance attribute stored within current object when called.
      Parameters:
      balance - a double number that is passed to this function when called so that current instance's balance attribute can be set to the value of argument.

    • getName

      public String getName()
      A public getter method that returns the name attribute stored within current object when called.
      Returns:
      name attribute of the current object.

    • setName

      public void setName(String name)
      A public setter method that sets the name attribute stored within current object when called.
      Parameters:
      name - a String that is passed to this function when called so that current instance's name attribute can be set to the value of argument.

    • combine

      public void combine(TransactionRecord tr)
      This method stores result of balance stored within the current instance and any transactions that the user might have in any given cycle back into the current instance's balance attribute. It gets the transaction amount be receiving an instance of TransactionRecord and making a call to getter method of the received instance. A transaction amount can be a positive number which indicates the amount was a purchase whereas a negative number indicates the amount was a payment.
      Parameters:
      tr - A TransactionRecord instance that is used to query the transaction amount whose return value is added back into the current instance's balance attribute.
